sub_title: Associate Professor Sustainable Land Use at Utrecht University
summary: I am an Associate Professor at Utrecht University. My research focuses on sustainable land use and biomass production for the biobased economy. I coordinate several international research projects on environmental and socio-economic impacts of land use, land use change, biomass production, and intensification of agriculture. I spent several working periods abroad (a.o. Mozambique, Ukraine, Brazil and South Africa). I'm frequently invited as speaker at international conferences and workshops. I supervise(d) 9 PhD students and 2 Postdocs and I teach in the Master programs 'Energy Science' and 'Sustainable Development' and the Bachelor program 'Global Sustainability Science'.

projects.title: Be Basic
projects.description:
BE-Basic is an international public-private partnership, funded by the Dutch government between universities, research institutes and industries of various scales in the field of sustainable chemistry and ecology.

Our mission is to develop industrial biobased solutions for a sustainable society.

profile_positions.description:
Coordination FS 9.1 Be-Basic: Identifying, Quantifying and Qualifying Sustainability for the
Biobased Economy
Reasearch on environmental and socio-economic impacts biomass supply chains, land use change, optimisation of biomass supply chains, and integrated assessments.
Research for Governments, NGOs and Industry
Supervision PhD Students
Supervision MSc and BSc theses
Education for MSc and BSc Students
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description:
Energy and Resources department of the Copernicus Institute for sustainable development of Utrecht University. 

Coordinator of the sustainability of biomass supply chains program of Be-Basic. Involved in several projects related to the assessment of the sustainability of biomass supply chains (bioenergy, biofuels and advanced routes). Supervisor of four PhD students and several MSc students working on several aspects of sustainability of biomass supply chains.   

My work focuses on the environmental and socio-economic impacts of biomass supply chains with special attention for land use changes. This involves modeling of scenarios, spatio-temporal land use changes, carbon stock changes, impacts on water, soil and biodiversity. In addition, it includes the assessment of the economic viability and the impacts on rural development and food security. It involves desk top study, modeling, expert consultation and extensive field work.
